page.description: The UX Component's QRCode control displays its value as a QR Code.

section.note: The QRCode control is a client-side control. That means that Javascript is used to generate the QR code. You can also use Xbasic methods to generate servers-side QR codes (as bitmaps or SVG). See ::Qrcode::Creator:: below for more details.

section.description: To place a QRCode control on a UX, select the control type from the toolbox.

section.description: New methods have been added to Xbasic to generate QRCodes. The methods are:
section.example: ::Qrcode::Creator::GenerateBmp(c text, c flags) ::Qrcode::Creator::GenerateBmpFile(c text, c filename, c flags) ::Qrcode::Creator::GenerateJpeg(c text, c flags) ::Qrcode::Creator::GenerateJpegFile(c text, c filename, c flags) ::Qrcode::Creator::GeneratePng(c text, c flags) ::Qrcode::Creator::GeneratePngFile(c text, c filename, c flags) ::Qrcode::Creator::GenerateRTF(c text, c flags, n width, n height) ::Qrcode::Creator::GenerateSVG(c text, c flags)

section.description:
The flags parameter can be set to 'L' (low), 'M' (medium) or 'H' (hight) to indicate the level of error correction in the generated QR Code.
For example, from the Interactive window:
section.example: dim svg as c svg = ::QRCode::Creator::GenerateSVG("http://www.alphasoftware.com","L") a5_show_html(svg)
